page.title: 12Llanhari community
page.content: The community of Llanhari with an area of some 660 hectares,consists of Llanhari village and three outlying hamlets,Gwaun Llanhari,Colliers Row and Tylegarw,together with a rather featureless council housing estate. Private housing is limited and further building projects are very limited due to natural and man made subsidence caused by the mining of iron ore in the locality.The surrounding area is occupied by farms and buildings of great antiquity. The area is situated on the northen edge of the Vale of Glamorgan,in the region known as the Border Vale,on a low undulating plateau between 75-90m above sea level.
